item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Chad add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chad add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "He who cannot draw on three thousand years is living from hand to mouth." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Chad add a quote by Alexis de Tocqueville
item.description: "The American Republic will endure until the day Congress discovers that it can bribe the public with the public's money." -- Alexis de Tocqueville

item.title: Chad add a quote by Alexis de Tocqueville
item.description: "When the taste for physical gratifications among them has grown more rapidly than their education . . . the time will come when men are carried away and lose all self-restraint . . . . It is not necessary to do violence to such a people in order to strip them of the rights they enjoy; they themselves willingly loosen their hold. . . . they neglect their chief business which is to remain their own masters." -- Alexis de Tocqueville

item.title: Chad add a quote by Alexis de Tocqueville
item.description: "I do not know if the people of the United States would vote for superior men if they ran for office, but there can be no doubt that such men do not run." -- Alexis de Tocqueville

item.title: Chad add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Chad add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Never memorize something that you can look up." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chad add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Chad add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Chad add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Chad add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.
